description: RNA extraction from water collected on Sterivex. The DNeasy PowerWater Sterivex kit is used and modified specifically for RNA. Also includes modifications for samples preserved in RNAlater.
before_start:
This protocol is modified from a MoBio Protocol. You will need:

 

a.) MoBio PowerWater DNA Isolation for Sterivex Kit (Catalog# 14600-50-NF) 

 

b.) Invitrogen Turbo DNase (Catalog # AM1907)
warning:
-WORK IN FUME HOOD FOR ALL STEPS INVOLVING  B-Mercaptoethanol (BME)

 

https://www.sciencelab.com/msds.php?msdsId=9924612

 

-Wear gloves and avoid skin contact with all reagents in MoBio and Invitrogen kits.

groups.group_name: The Aquatic Microbial Ecology Research Group - AMERG (The Buchan, Zinser and Wilhelm labs)

guidelines:
What you will need:

 

-Kit: Qiagen DNeasy PowerWater Sterivex kit (formerly MoBio PowerWater DNA Isolation for Sterivex (Catalog# 14600-50-NF))

-Kit: Invitrogen Turbo DNase (Catalog# AM1907)

-B-mercaptoethanol (BME) *

-65ºC incubator

-70ºC incubator

-4ºC refrigerator

-Vortex

-100% RNase free EtOH

-RNase free H2O

-60 mL or 3mL sterile syringes (If using RNAlater solution)

 

* See warnings

components.data: Add solution ST1A to bottle ST1B  (provided in kit).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add solution ST1A to bottle ST1B  (provided in kit).

components.data: Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)
source_data.annotation: Only required the first time you use ST1B, it can be kept at 4°C for storage when not in use.
source_data.thread_text: Only required the first time you use ST1B, it can be kept at 4°C for storage when not in use.
source_data.body: Only required the first time you use ST1B, it can be kept at 4°C for storage when not in use.

components.data: Warm solutions ST2 and ST4 prior to use at 65°C for 5-10 minutes. Use while warm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Warm solutions ST2 and ST4 prior to use at 65°C for 5-10 minutes. Use while warm.

components.data: Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)
source_data.annotation: Solutions ST2 and ST4 are salty solutions and precipitates, must be dissolved prior to use.
source_data.thread_text: Solutions ST2 and ST4 are salty solutions and precipitates, must be dissolved prior to use.
source_data.body: Solutions ST2 and ST4 are salty solutions and precipitates, must be dissolved prior to use.

components.data: If Sterivex were capped with clay at the outlet and no screw cap is available, use electrical tape to secure the opening. The clay may not hold during the entire extraction process and this will prevent your lysate from leaking.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If Sterivex were capped with clay at the outlet and no screw cap is available, use electrical tape to secure the opening. The clay may not hold during the entire extraction process and this will prevent your lysate from leaking.

components.data: Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove RNAlater from Sterivex. If clay was used to plug the outlet, unplug with a sterile needle.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove RNAlater from Sterivex. If clay was used to plug the outlet, unplug with a sterile needle.

components.data: For samples preserved in RNAlater
components.name: Section

components.data:
Connect a sterile syringe to the inlet and flush Sterivex with ~ 50mL RNase free H2O. 

* Make sure all water is pushed out before moving forward.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Connect a sterile syringe to the inlet and flush Sterivex with ~ 50mL RNase free H2O. 

* Make sure all water is pushed out before moving forward.

components.data: For samples preserved in RNAlater
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)
source_data.annotation: Be sure to Re-plug or Re-cap the outlet.
source_data.thread_text: Be sure to Re-plug or Re-cap the outlet.
source_data.body: Be sure to Re-plug or Re-cap the outlet.

components.data:
Pull back the plunger of a 3mL syringe to fill the barrel with 1mL (or more) air.

Attach the syringe to the inlet end of the Sterivex and hold the unit vertically with the syringe at the bottom to allow as much of the lysate as possible to be near the inlet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Pull back the plunger of a 3mL syringe to fill the barrel with 1mL (or more) air.

Attach the syringe to the inlet end of the Sterivex and hold the unit vertically with the syringe at the bottom to allow as much of the lysate as possible to be near the inlet.

components.data: Alternative for RNAlater removal if pushing liquid through the Sterivex is not an option
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Alternative for RNAlater removal if pushing liquid through the Sterivex is not an option

components.data:
Push air into the unit until there is a resistance and release the plunger. You may not feel resistance but if you push and pull air in and out a couple of times, it should work to pull the lysate into the syringe. 

DO NOT FORCE AIR THROUGH THE STERIVEX.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Push air into the unit until there is a resistance and release the plunger. You may not feel resistance but if you push and pull air in and out a couple of times, it should work to pull the lysate into the syringe. 

DO NOT FORCE AIR THROUGH THE STERIVEX.

components.data:
Collect the RNAlater in a centrifuge tube if cells detach from the filter. 

Centrifuge to pellet cells and discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Collect the RNAlater in a centrifuge tube if cells detach from the filter. 

Centrifuge to pellet cells and discard the supernatant.

components.data: Resuspend cells in the 900μL ST1B/BME solution, and add back into the Sterivex through the inlet. Insert pipette completely into the inlet so that the pipette tip is visible inside the unit just above the membrane.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend cells in the 900μL ST1B/BME solution, and add back into the Sterivex through the inlet. Insert pipette completely into the inlet so that the pipette tip is visible inside the unit just above the membrane.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 12 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)

components.data:
(900μL) ST1B/Beta-mercaptoethanol (BME) solution will be needed per sample and every sample. Prepare fresh daily as needed. 

 

Combine (20μL) of BME with (880μL) ST1B.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
(900μL) ST1B/Beta-mercaptoethanol (BME) solution will be needed per sample and every sample. Prepare fresh daily as needed. 

 

Combine (20μL) of BME with (880μL) ST1B.

components.data: Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove inlet cap and add (900μL) of the ST1B/BME solution use a pipette tip. Insert pipette completely into the inlet so that the pipette tip is visible inside the unit just above the membrane.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove inlet cap and add (900μL) of the ST1B/BME solution use a pipette tip. Insert pipette completely into the inlet so that the pipette tip is visible inside the unit just above the membrane.

components.data: If RNAlater was not used.
components.name: Section

components.data: Recap the inlet and secure the Sterivex filter unit horizontally with the inlet facing out.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Recap the inlet and secure the Sterivex filter unit horizontally with the inlet facing out.

components.data: Continue as follows regardless of RNAlater utilization.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Continue as follows regardless of RNAlater utilization.

components.data: Vortex at minimum speed for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex at minimum speed for 5 minutes.

components.data: While still attached to the vortex adapter, rotate the Sterivex 180 degrees from the original position.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: While still attached to the vortex adapter, rotate the Sterivex 180 degrees from the original position.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 16 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)
source_data.annotation: Marking initial position on the inlet cap may be useful.
source_data.thread_text: Marking initial position on the inlet cap may be useful.
source_data.body: Marking initial position on the inlet cap may be useful.

components.data: Vortex at minimum speed for an additional 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex at minimum speed for an additional 5 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 17 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)
source_data.annotation: An increase in time may be necessary if many cells are still attached to the filter.
source_data.thread_text: An increase in time may be necessary if many cells are still attached to the filter.
source_data.body: An increase in time may be necessary if many cells are still attached to the filter.

components.data: Set the Sterivex with the inlet facing up and remove the inlet cap.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Set the Sterivex with the inlet facing up and remove the inlet cap.

components.data: Add (900μL) of ST2 solution using a pipette tip and recap the inlet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add (900μL) of ST2 solution using a pipette tip and recap the inlet.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 19 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)

components.data: Incubate the Sterivex at 70ºC for 10 minutes, be sure to place unit for equal distribution of heat.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the Sterivex at 70ºC for 10 minutes, be sure to place unit for equal distribution of heat.

components.data: Cool the unit at room temperature for two minutes. Ensure caps are on tightly, as they may loosen after heating.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cool the unit at room temperature for two minutes. Ensure caps are on tightly, as they may loosen after heating.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 21 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)
source_data.annotation: It is importatnt to cool the unit before re-tightening the caps to minimize warping of the inlet.
source_data.thread_text: It is importatnt to cool the unit before re-tightening the caps to minimize warping of the inlet.
source_data.body: It is importatnt to cool the unit before re-tightening the caps to minimize warping of the inlet.

components.data: Secure the Sterivex on the vortex with the inlet facing out n. Vortex at maximum speed for 7.5-10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Secure the Sterivex on the vortex with the inlet facing out n. Vortex at maximum speed for 7.5-10 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 22 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)
source_data.annotation: Critical step for removing the remaining cells from filter and effectively lysing the cells.
source_data.thread_text: Critical step for removing the remaining cells from filter and effectively lysing the cells.
source_data.body: Critical step for removing the remaining cells from filter and effectively lysing the cells.

components.data: Using the provided 3mL syringe, pull back the plunger with 1mL (or more) of air. Attach the syringe to the inlet of the Sterivex and hold the unit vertically with the syringe at the bottom to allow as much of the lysate as possible to be near the inlet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using the provided 3mL syringe, pull back the plunger with 1mL (or more) of air. Attach the syringe to the inlet of the Sterivex and hold the unit vertically with the syringe at the bottom to allow as much of the lysate as possible to be near the inlet.

components.data: Push air into the unit until there is a resistance and release the plunger. Repeat air resistance process until you are able to pull the lysate out into the syringe.  *DO NOT FORCE AIR THROUGH THE STERIVEX*
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Push air into the unit until there is a resistance and release the plunger. Repeat air resistance process until you are able to pull the lysate out into the syringe.  *DO NOT FORCE AIR THROUGH THE STERIVEX*

components.data: Add the lysate to the 5mL PowerWater Sterivex glass Bead Tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the lysate to the 5mL PowerWater Sterivex glass Bead Tube.

components.data: Secure the BeadTube with the lysate to the vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Secure the BeadTube with the lysate to the vortex.

components.data: Vortex at maximum speed for 7.5-10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex at maximum speed for 7.5-10 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 27 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)
source_data.annotation: This step is critical for homogenization and lysis of the cells.
source_data.thread_text: This step is critical for homogenization and lysis of the cells.
source_data.body: This step is critical for homogenization and lysis of the cells.

components.data: Centrifuge the tube at 3600 x g for 2 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the tube at 3600 x g for 2 minutes at room temperature.

components.data:
Placing the pipette tip down into the beads against the bottom of the tube, transfer all the supernatant out to a clean 2.2mL collection tube provided in kit. Pipet more than once to ensure removal of supernatant. 

Any carry over of beads will not affect the subsequent steps.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Placing the pipette tip down into the beads against the bottom of the tube, transfer all the supernatant out to a clean 2.2mL collection tube provided in kit. Pipet more than once to ensure removal of supernatant. 

Any carry over of beads will not affect the subsequent steps.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 29 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)

components.data:
Add 300μL of ST3 solution and vortex briefly to mix

 

.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 300μL of ST3 solution and vortex briefly to mix

 

.

components.data: Incubate at 4ºC for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 4ºC for 5 minutes.

components.data: Centrifuge the tubes at 13000 x g for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the tubes at 13000 x g for 1 minute.

components.data: Avoiding the pellet, transfer the supernatant to a clean 5mL collection tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Avoiding the pellet, transfer the supernatant to a clean 5mL collection tube.

components.data: Add 1.5mL of 100% RNase-free EtOH and 1.5mL of warmed ST4 Solution, then mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1.5mL of 100% RNase-free EtOH and 1.5mL of warmed ST4 Solution, then mix.

components.data: Place a binding column (provided) into a 2.2mL microcentrifuge tube (provided). Add previous solution (step 32) to the binding column (800μL) at a time. Centrifuge at 13000 x g for 1 minute and discard the supernatant each time to collect the RNA in the filter.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place a binding column (provided) into a 2.2mL microcentrifuge tube (provided). Add previous solution (step 32) to the binding column (800μL) at a time. Centrifuge at 13000 x g for 1 minute and discard the supernatant each time to collect the RNA in the filter.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 35 of RNA Extraction for Sterivex (Modified from MoBio Protocol)
source_data.annotation: This step replaces the need to use the vacuum manifold. The vacuum manifold tends to get clogged up when the samples are salty (i.e. with use of RNAlater) and in general takes a long time to actually filter.
source_data.thread_text: This step replaces the need to use the vacuum manifold. The vacuum manifold tends to get clogged up when the samples are salty (i.e. with use of RNAlater) and in general takes a long time to actually filter.
source_data.body: This step replaces the need to use the vacuum manifold. The vacuum manifold tends to get clogged up when the samples are salty (i.e. with use of RNAlater) and in general takes a long time to actually filter.

components.data: When all of the solution from step 32 has been filtered through the binding column completely, centrifuge one final time for 1 minute to ensure the filter is completely dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When all of the solution from step 32 has been filtered through the binding column completely, centrifuge one final time for 1 minute to ensure the filter is completely dry.

components.data: Transfer the binding column to a new 2.2mL microcentrifuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the binding column to a new 2.2mL microcentrifuge tube.

components.data: Add 800 μL of Solution ST5 to the binding column, and let sit for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 800 μL of Solution ST5 to the binding column, and let sit for 1 minute.

components.data: Centrifuge for 1 minute at 13000 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 1 minute at 13000 x g.

components.data: Discard the supernatant and centrifuge again for 1 minute to ensure filter is completely dry. Discard residual supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant and centrifuge again for 1 minute to ensure filter is completely dry. Discard residual supernatant.

components.data: Shake solution ST6 to mix well. Add 800 μL of ST6 and let sit for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Shake solution ST6 to mix well. Add 800 μL of ST6 and let sit for 1 minute.

components.data: Centrifuge ST6 solution for 1 minute at 13000 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge ST6 solution for 1 minute at 13000 x g.

components.data: Discard the supernatant, and centrifuge again for 1 minute to ensure filter is completely dry. Discard residual supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant, and centrifuge again for 1 minute to ensure filter is completely dry. Discard residual supernatant.

components.data: Again, add 800 μL of Solution ST5 to binding column. Let sit for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Again, add 800 μL of Solution ST5 to binding column. Let sit for 1 minute.

components.data: Place binding column into a new 1.5 mL centrifuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place binding column into a new 1.5 mL centrifuge tube.

components.data: Add 100 μL of RNase-free water to the center of the filter. Let sit for 1-5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 μL of RNase-free water to the center of the filter. Let sit for 1-5 minutes.

components.data: Centrifuge at room temperature for 1 minute at 13,000 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at room temperature for 1 minute at 13,000 x g.

components.data: RNA is collected this time, discard the binding column.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: RNA is collected this time, discard the binding column.

components.data: Use Turbo DNase kit for DNase treatment. Follow manufacturer's protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use Turbo DNase kit for DNase treatment. Follow manufacturer's protocol.

components.data: http:/http://tools.thermofisher.com/content/sfs/manuals/cms_055740.pdf
components.name: External Link

components.data: RNA ready to use, or store at -80º C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: RNA ready to use, or store at -80º C.

components.data: Discard the supernatant and centrifuge again for 1 minute to ensure the filter is completely dry. Discard the residual supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant and centrifuge again for 1 minute to ensure the filter is completely dry. Discard the residual supernatant.

components.data: Add 800μL of 100% RNase free EtOH to the binding column. Let sit for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 800μL of 100% RNase free EtOH to the binding column. Let sit for 1 minute.

components.data: If RNAlater was used.
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge 100% EtOH for 1 minute at 13000 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge 100% EtOH for 1 minute at 13000 x g.

components.data: If RNAlater was used.
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge again for 2 minutes to ensure filter is completely dry. Discard residual supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge again for 2 minutes to ensure filter is completely dry. Discard residual supernatant.

components.data: Continue as follows regardless of RNAlater utilization.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Continue as follows regardless of RNAlater utilization.

components.data: Discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant.

components.data: If RNAlater was used.
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge solution ST5 for 1 minute at 13000 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge solution ST5 for 1 minute at 13000 x g.
